7249992b62bbe8ba01df41df1bb1b6122d1f2ba4.summary: Android: Target SDK 28, required by Google from Aug 2019

332d74bcaf4c4d596a1d05f1891dc53be300b5af.summary: AppVeyor: Skip saving cache on non-master branches
332d74bcaf4c4d596a1d05f1891dc53be300b5af.body:
Otherwise we run into situations where commits to stable branches
induce very long build times, as they have to basically build from
scratch but also invalidate the cache for future commits on the
master branch.

This commit also makes the cache folder branch-specific, but since
it's still limited to 1 GB of total cache size, we don't enable it
for non-master, as we would still run into issues with non-master
build invalidating the master cache.

(cherry picked from commit b021bdbf1f72e0364e49bd506eab61d7ed0d57bf)

b021bdbf1f72e0364e49bd506eab61d7ed0d57bf.summary: AppVeyor: Skip saving cache on non-master branches
b021bdbf1f72e0364e49bd506eab61d7ed0d57bf.body:
Otherwise we run into situations where commits to stable branches
induce very long build times, as they have to basically build from
scratch but also invalidate the cache for future commits on the
master branch.

This commit also makes the cache folder branch-specific, but since
it's still limited to 1 GB of total cache size, we don't enable it
for non-master, as we would still run into issues with non-master
build invalidating the master cache.

717d79e540ad0e9eed2e10088bdc2936e060ddcf.summary: SCons: Default to builtin libpng/freetype on Linux (+ openssl)
717d79e540ad0e9eed2e10088bdc2936e060ddcf.body:
The rationale for keeping those shared by default is that they're typical
dependencies found on any Linux system, and it saves compilation time and
binary size to link their dynamically.

But since official builds default to all-builtin, and Debian/Ubuntu still
don't have libpng16 (which we now require) readily available on all their
supported releases, it's simpler to bundle all the things.

This does not change the fact that those dependencies *can* be unbundled
on Linux, it's only the default option changing.

(cherry picked from commit 1769cbc0e24c13f4d31d7e0857275653ec9281e0)

For 2.1, also building by default against bundled openssl.

1769cbc0e24c13f4d31d7e0857275653ec9281e0.summary: SCons: Default to builtin libpng/freetype on Linux (+ openssl)
1769cbc0e24c13f4d31d7e0857275653ec9281e0.body:
The rationale for keeping those shared by default is that they're typical
dependencies found on any Linux system, and it saves compilation time and
binary size to link their dynamically.

But since official builds default to all-builtin, and Debian/Ubuntu still
don't have libpng16 (which we now require) readily available on all their
supported releases, it's simpler to bundle all the things.

This does not change the fact that those dependencies *can* be unbundled
on Linux, it's only the default option changing.



For 2.1, also building by default against bundled openssl.

9ef833ec6d275e6271811f256acf23e29b2ccc33.summary: HTML5: Do not error on undefined symbols
9ef833ec6d275e6271811f256acf23e29b2ccc33.body:
Emscripten used not to error out on those warnings, but this behaviour changed
recently, so we revert it to be able to compile as we used to for previous 2.1.x
releases. It would be good to fix those undefined symbols though.

e898b0a3a8fa10c97d16238392d8738474d18c7a.summary: Android: Enable arm64-v8a export by default
e898b0a3a8fa10c97d16238392d8738474d18c7a.body:
From August 1, 2019, Google Play requires that all new apps and app updates
include 64-bit versions, so we enable ARM64 by default.

IINM support for x86 and x86_64 is still be optional, so not enabling them
out of the box.

Part of #25030.

(cherry picked from commit 9e820cdf200576cefaabc2021a800771cd6700a7)

9e820cdf200576cefaabc2021a800771cd6700a7.summary: Android: Enable arm64-v8a export by default
9e820cdf200576cefaabc2021a800771cd6700a7.body:
From August 1, 2019, Google Play requires that all new apps and app updates
include 64-bit versions, so we enable ARM64 by default.

IINM support for x86 and x86_64 is still be optional, so not enabling them
out of the box.

Part of #25030.

b768381998968c1e7527074f678317ebae75393a.summary: Android: Add support for x86_64 architecture
b768381998968c1e7527074f678317ebae75393a.body:
Like arm64v8, this is only supported by API 21 and later,
so we enforce 21 as min API for x86_64.

Part of #25030.

(cherry picked from commit 7f4ee3646904fd90a6495b7549722acd9c8351af)

7f4ee3646904fd90a6495b7549722acd9c8351af.summary: Android: Add support for x86_64 architecture
7f4ee3646904fd90a6495b7549722acd9c8351af.body:
Like arm64v8, this is only supported by API 21 and later,
so we enforce 21 as min API for x86_64.

Part of #25030.
